title: High-Tech Entrepreneurship and New Media Software Development: Constructivist Practice Community Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational software development skills, understanding of entrepreneurial processes, and project management experience
context.additional_context: Students develop software solutions addressing real startup challenges through university-industry collaborative projects, accumulating hands-on experience in an online collaborative environment based on constructivist learning principles.

learning_goals: Design and implement a team-based software prototype to solve real-world industrial problems.
Specify a new media technology-based business model through analysis of entrepreneurial ecosystems.
Lead peer evaluation and feedback processes using a Learning Management System (LMS) and sustain Community of Practice (CoP) activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
